title: Hype um L'Oréal S.A.: Beauty-Gigant, virale Produkte – und was die Aktie jetzt macht
description:
Alle reden drüber, alle posten es – aber was steckt wirklich hinter L'Oréal S.A., dem vielleicht einflussreichsten Beauty-Konzern der Welt?
Besonders spannend: Während du auf TikTok neue L'Oréal-Produkte speicherst, schauen Investorinnen und Anleger auf die Loreal Aktie.
Die Loreal Aktie mit der ISIN FR0000120321 wird an der Euronext Paris gehandelt und zählt zu den großen europäischen Konsumwerten.
Zum zuletzt verfügbaren Handelsstand lag die Loreal Aktie bei rund Last Close: ca.
Ob im Badezimmerschrank oder im Depot: L'Oréal S.A. zeigt, wie hart Beauty und Business inzwischen zusammenhängen.
text:
Alle reden drüber, alle posten es – aber was steckt wirklich hinter L'Oréal S.A., dem vielleicht einflussreichsten Beauty-Konzern der Welt? Virale Mascaras, Skin-Tints, Haarpflege – und dahinter ein Milliarden-Unternehmen mit eigener Aktie. Zeit für einen Reality-Check: Hype wert oder nur Marketing-Zauber?

Besonders spannend: Während du auf TikTok neue L'Oréal-Produkte speicherst, schauen Investorinnen und Anleger auf die Loreal Aktie. Beauty im Bad, Börse im Hintergrund – und beides kann für dich richtig interessant werden.

Das Netz dreht durch: L'Oréal S.A. auf TikTok & Co.

Scroll mal durch deine For-You-Page: Gefühlt jede Woche ist irgendein L'Oréal-Produkt ein neuer viraler Hit. Foundation, die wie ein Filter aussieht. Mascara, die angeblich falsche Wimpern ersetzt. Haarpflege, die "alles rettet".

Die Stimmung im Netz: Eine Mischung aus Hype, "Muss ich testen!" und natürlich auch Skepsis. Unter den Videos häufen sich Kommentare wie "Okay, aber lohnt sich das wirklich?" und "Brauche echte Erfahrungen, nicht nur Werbung". Gleichzeitig gehen Before/After-Clips mit Millionen Views durch die Decke.

Auf Reddit, Insta und TikTok sieht man drei Trends:

Hype & FOMO: User posten ihre Erfahrung mit viralen L'Oréal-Produkten – viele feiern das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis im Vergleich zu Luxusmarken.

Angst vor Fail: Einige warnen: "Achtung, auf meiner Haut hat das gar nicht funktioniert" – vor allem bei sensibler Haut oder falschem Farbton.

Memes: Clips à la "Ich: Kauf nix mehr. Auch ich nach 3 TikToks: *L'Oréal-Haul*" – der Effekt: Impulskäufe ohne Ende.

Willst du sehen, was die Leute sagen? Hier geht's zu den echten Meinungen:

??Die viralsten TikToks zu L'Oréal S.A. ansehen

??Ausführliche Tests auf YouTube checken

Top oder Flop? Das kann das neue Modell

Klar, L'Oréal ist keine einzelne Mascara oder ein einzelnes Serum – aber jedes Jahr kommen neue Must-have-Produkte hinzu, die online komplett eskalieren. Drei Dinge stechen immer wieder raus:

1. Preis-Hammer im Drogerie-Regal

L'Oréal positioniert viele Hits im mittleren Preissegment: teurer als absolute Billigmarken, aber deutlich günstiger als Luxuslabels. Für viele ist das die perfekte Zone: "Fühlt sich High-End an, aber zerstört mein Konto nicht". Genau hier entsteht der Preis-Hammer-Effekt – vor allem, wenn Creator L'Oréal als "Dupe" zu teuren Marken hypen.

2. Performance, die TikTok-tauglich ist

Produkte, die sichtbar etwas machen – mehr Glow, mehr Volumen, stärkere Deckkraft – performen online natürlich besser. Viele L'Oréal-Produkte liefern sofortige Before/After-Effekte, die man in einem 10-Sekunden-Clip sieht. Das pusht den Hype, weil User direkt sagen: "Okay, das will ich testen".

3. Riesige Auswahl – von Basic bis Pro-Look

Make-up, Hautpflege, Haarfarbe, Styling: L'Oréal bedient alles. Das heißt für dich: Du findest für fast jeden Look ein passendes Produkt – vom Alltags-Make-up bis zum Insta-Ready-Full-Face. Nachteil: Die Auswahl kann auch überfordern, und ohne guten Test oder ehrliche Review greifst du schnell daneben.

Achtung: Nur weil etwas viral ist, passt es nicht automatisch zu deinem Hauttyp oder Haar. Die besten Erfahrungen machen User, die vorher auf Inhaltsstoffe und Hautbedürfnisse achten – und nicht nur auf den Trend.

L'Oréal S.A. vs. Die Konkurrenz

Wer ist der größte Gegner im Beauty-Game? Ganz klar: Estée Lauder mit Marken wie MAC, Clinique oder The Ordinary. Beide Konzerne sind globale Riesen – aber sie spielen das Game unterschiedlich.

L'Oréal S.A.: Stark in der Breite, überall präsent – Drogerie, Online, Parfümerie. Viele Untermarken (z. B. Maybelline, NYX, Garnier), extrem aggressiv auf Social Media, viel Kooperation mit Creatorinnen und Influencern.

Estée Lauder: Mehr Fokus auf Premium- und Luxussegment, starke Präsenz in Parfümerien und High-End-Stores, oft teurer, dafür mit Luxus-Image.

Für die TikTok-Generation hat aktuell L'Oréal klar die Nase vorn. Warum? Weil die Brand es besser schafft, massentaugliche Produkte in virale Momente zu verwandeln. Wenn es um pure Reichweite, Verfügbarkeit und Social-Media-Hype geht, ist L'Oréal im Moment der Gewinner.

Wenn du allerdings auf superminimalistische Formulierungen, Nischenbrands oder cleane Indie-Marken stehst, wirken beide Beauty-Giganten für dich vielleicht eher wie die "Boomer" der Kosmetik-Welt.

Fazit: Kaufen oder sein lassen?

Also: Lohnt sich das? Aus User-Sicht sind L'Oréal-Produkte oft ein guter Mix aus Preis und Performance. Viele berichten von soliden Ergebnissen, besonders bei Make-up und Haarpflege. Für den Alltag okay bis richtig gut – mit ein paar echten Banger-Produkten dazwischen.

Aber: Blind alles kaufen, was viral ist, ist keine gute Idee. Gerade bei Hautpflege lohnt sich ein Blick in Inhaltsstoffe und echte Erfahrungsberichte. "Eine Creatorin hat's empfohlen" ist kein Hautarzt.

Wenn du:

ein günstigeres Dupe zu teurer High-End-Kosmetik suchst,

auf Social Media Produktempfehlungen stehst, aber bereit bist, sie kritisch zu hinterfragen,

und einfach Bock auf neue Looks hast, ohne Luxuspreise zu zahlen,

dann kann sich L'Oréal für dich definitiv lohnen. Tipp: Schau dir vor dem Kauf mindestens ein bis zwei unabhängige Tests auf YouTube an und check die Kommentare – da siehst du schnell, ob der Hype echt ist oder ein Fail droht.

Hinter den Kulissen: Loreal Aktie

Spannend für alle, die nicht nur Beauty im Bad, sondern auch Geld an der Börse haben wollen: Hinter den viralen Produkten steckt ein Börsenriese. Die Loreal Aktie mit der ISIN FR0000120321 wird an der Euronext Paris gehandelt und zählt zu den großen europäischen Konsumwerten.

Wichtiger Hinweis zum Kurs: Die folgenden Angaben basieren auf öffentlichen Finanzportalen. Aktuelle Kurse können sich jederzeit ändern, du solltest vor einer Entscheidung immer selbst nachschauen.

Zum zuletzt verfügbaren Handelsstand lag die Loreal Aktie bei rund Last Close: ca. 440–450 Euro je Aktie (Angabe gerundet, basierend auf gängigen Finanzseiten, bezogen auf den letzten offiziellen Handelsschluss). Der Kurs hat sich in den vergangenen Monaten insgesamt stabil bis leicht positiv entwickelt, mit typischen Schwankungen, wie sie bei großen Konsum- und Luxuswerten normal sind.

Warum ist das spannend? Weil der Markt L'Oréal als relativ robusten Konzern sieht: starke Marken, weltweite Präsenz, ständig neue Trends – und eben diese viralen Hits, die du auf TikTok siehst, können langfristig auch den Umsatz pushen. Heißt aber nicht automatisch, dass die Aktie "nur steigen" kann. Auch hier gilt: Achtung, keine Kaufempfehlung – informier dich immer selbst, check aktuelle Kurse und im Zweifel professionelle Beratung.

Ob im Badezimmerschrank oder im Depot: L'Oréal S.A. zeigt, wie hart Beauty und Business inzwischen zusammenhängen. Und du entscheidest, ob du nur den Lipgloss kaufst – oder gleich noch ein Stück vom Konzern.

name: OpenAI
title: Explainer: IndiaMART vs OpenAI - When AI Silence Becomes Market Barrier
description:
The Calcutta High Court’s early observation matters because it treats omission by an AI interface as a real market action.
According to the petition, OpenAI relied on these reports mechanically, without independent assessment or notice to IndiaMART.
In its petition, IndiaMART compared its role to that of advertising media.
If AI platforms shape market visibility without transparency, they exercise economic power outside traditional regulatory oversight.
The court will examine whether AI platforms must explain exclusions that affect market access, or whether automated systems can continue to operate without clear accountability.
text:
India’s largest B2B marketplace, IndiaMART InterMESH Limited, has taken OpenAI to the Calcutta High Court, alleging that ChatGPT selectively excluded the platform from AI-generated responses while mentioning rival marketplaces. What began as a dispute over search visibility has grown into a wider legal examination of how artificial intelligence shapes commercial outcomes, market access, and reputational standing in the digital economy.

The matter came up before Justice Ravi Krishna Kapur, who refused to grant immediate relief but made a sharp prima facie observation that IndiaMART appeared to be excluded “without any logic”. The court recognised that such exclusion can cause loss of goodwill, reputation, and commercial injury. The case now moves toward a detailed hearing scheduled for January 13, 2026.

Why This Case Matters Beyond IndiaMART

This dispute does not turn on whether ChatGPT should promote one marketplace over another. It raises a deeper question. Can an AI system, acting as a discovery layer for commercial information, decide which businesses users see without explaining how those decisions are made?

The Calcutta High Court’s early observation matters because it treats omission by an AI interface as a real market action. The court did not see AI outputs as neutral technical artefacts. Instead, it acknowledged that silence in AI-generated responses can shape perception, divert business, and distort competition.

What IndiaMART Told the Court

IndiaMART alleged that ChatGPT “specifically and consciously” chose to exclude the platform from responses where comparable B2B marketplaces were referenced. According to the petition, this was not a random error. The company claimed that OpenAI relied mechanically on reports issued by the United States Trade Representative (USTR), without any independent evaluation or opportunity of hearing.

The USTR is a US government agency that develops and enforces American trade policy. Its annual reports assess global trade and intellectual property practices from a US perspective. These reports influence policy debates but do not carry legal force outside the United States.

IndiaMART approached the court seeking a declaration that USTR findings were not binding on ChatGPT and could not form the basis for excluding its website and listings from AI-generated responses.

The High Court’s Initial View

While declining ad-interim relief, the court recorded a clear prima facie concern about selective discrimination.

“It prima facie appears that the petitioner is being selectively discriminated against and justifiably excluded without any logic. Inevitably, there is a loss of goodwill, reputation, and commercial injury, which is being caused to the petitioner,”

The High Court reasoned that granting immediate directions to alter ChatGPT outputs would amount to final relief without hearing OpenAI and other respondents. At the same time, it acknowledged that suppressed visibility on AI interfaces could cause continuing commercial harm.

What IndiaMART Is Asking For

At the interim stage, IndiaMART asked the court to restrain OpenAI from blacklisting or excluding its website, mobile application, and live product listings from ChatGPT-generated outputs. It also sought directions preventing OpenAI from relying on USTR reviews as a basis for excluding Indian businesses.

The petition further asked the court to direct removal of any internal filters or safeguards that suppress IndiaMART’s listings, along with ancillary reliefs, including costs.

IndiaMART framed its case around the idea that omission by an AI system can mislead users when that system functions as a primary source of commercial discovery. According to the petition, excluding IndiaMART while surfacing rival platforms presents a distorted picture of the B2B marketplace.

The company argued that this amounts to passing off through adverse commercial association. It also alleged trade libel and injurious falsehood, contending that silence by omission can operate as implied disparagement when users rely on AI-generated responses to make commercial decisions.

IndiaMART further claimed unfair competition. Distorted AI-driven visibility, it argued, can redirect users and enquiries toward competitors without any transparent or objective basis. Such harm, the company said, cannot be cured through monetary compensation alone.

The USTR Issue at the Core of the Dispute

A central factual issue concerns OpenAI’s alleged reliance on USTR reviews. IndiaMART argued that these reviews do not constitute binding legal determinations and carry no enforceable authority in India.

According to the petition, OpenAI relied on these reports mechanically, without independent assessment or notice to IndiaMART. The company also alleged selective application. Other platforms named in USTR reports for counterfeiting or piracy continue to appear in ChatGPT responses.

IndiaMART pointed out that it does not feature on the European Union’s Counterfeit and Piracy Watch List. It also relied on an Indian Government press release stating that India is under no obligation to act on USTR findings. On this basis, the company argued that OpenAI imported foreign policy judgments into Indian commercial space through code.

IndiaMART operates a B2B marketplace that connects buyers and sellers, with a strong focus on small and medium enterprises. Through its website and mobile application, suppliers list products and services, while buyers search, compare, and engage.

In its petition, IndiaMART compared its role to that of advertising media. Visibility, it argued, determines whether suppliers receive enquiries and whether buyers discover competing offerings.

To show scale and impact, IndiaMART stated that as of September 30, 2025, it had around 42 million registered buyers, over 124 million listed products, and more than 8.3 million registered suppliers. During the 2024–25 financial year, the platform generated about 458 million business enquiries.

Against this backdrop, exclusion from AI-generated responses was framed as a direct hit to market access.

Brand Dilution and Trademark Protection

IndiaMART also relied on the legal status of its brand. Its mark has been declared a well-known trademark under the Trade Marks Act, 1999. This status attracts enhanced protection against dilution and unfair commercial association.

According to the petition, exclusion from AI outputs dilutes goodwill attached to the mark and amounts to implied disparagement by omission. When an AI system highlights competing platforms while remaining silent about a well-known marketplace, it sends a misleading signal about relevance and credibility.

The dispute aligns with concerns raised by the Competition Commission of India, which has warned that AI systems can distort competition through automated decision-making, even without human intent. If AI platforms shape market visibility without transparency, they exercise economic power outside traditional regulatory oversight.

What Happens Next

The court directed IndiaMART to notify OpenAI and other respondents through multiple modes, including email and courier. The matter will come up for further hearing on January 13, 2026.

How the case proceeds could shape the future obligations of AI intermediaries in India. The court will examine whether AI platforms must explain exclusions that affect market access, or whether automated systems can continue to operate without clear accountability.

Senior Advocates SN Mookherjee and Rudraman Bhattacharyya with Advocates Sourojit Dasgupta, SK Bajoria, Dhruv Chaddha, Gargi Vashistha, Siddhartha Banerjee and Akash Munshi represented IndiaMART.

name: Adobe
outlet: Adobe’s Stock: A Tale of Conflicting Signals
title: Adobe's Stock: A Tale of Conflicting Signals - ad-hoc-news.de
description:
As Adobe enters the new year, investors are weighing a complex set of market signals.
On the other, recent technical weakness in the share price and institutional selling activity have introduced a note of caution.
The stock closed at $349.99, just below a psychologically significant level, after being unable to sustain several intraday attempts to move higher.
Proponents view this as a relatively attractive valuation for a company delivering double-digit revenue growth.
The strategic imperative is to leverage generative AI as a growth catalyst rather than a threat.
text:
As Adobe enters the new year, investors are weighing a complex set of market signals. On one hand, robust financial performance and bullish analyst commentary provide a foundation for optimism. On the other, recent technical weakness in the share price and institutional selling activity have introduced a note of caution. The central investment thesis now hinges on the company's ability to successfully monetize its artificial intelligence offerings.

Contrasting with positive analyst views, data on institutional investors reveals a more cautious stance. On December 31, Marietta Wealth Management LLC reported a significant reduction in its Adobe holdings, selling over 4,000 shares for a decrease of approximately 18.2% in its position.

This transaction fits a pattern of typical portfolio rebalancing at year-end. Many asset managers adjust their weightings within the technology sector, locking in gains or reducing overall risk exposure. While Marietta's move is part of this broader sector-wide rebalancing and not necessarily a direct vote against Adobe, it underscores that some major investors opted for a more defensive posture as the calendar turned.

Mixed Technical Picture to Close the Year

The final trading session of 2025 on the Nasdaq failed to provide clear directional momentum for Adobe shares. The stock closed at $349.99, just below a psychologically significant level, after being unable to sustain several intraday attempts to move higher. The price action suggested a fading of momentum rather than a dynamic year-end finish.

This displayed weakness aligns with a mixed broader chart pattern. While the equity gained roughly 26% over the past month, it remains down by a significant 18% over a twelve-month horizon. Currently trading more than 20% below its 52-week high of $445.25, the stock cannot yet be said to be in a sustained recovery rally.

Bullish Analysts Highlight Valuation Gap

Fundamental analysis presents a more constructive picture than recent price action suggests. A fresh analysis published on Seeking Alpha on December 31 posits that Adobe may be undervalued at current levels, setting a price target of $595—substantially above the present trading price.

Should investors sell immediately? Or is it worth buying Adobe?

The rationale centers on valuation. Despite widespread concerns that generative AI could disrupt its business model, Adobe posted record financial results for fiscal 2025. Based on these figures, the analysis calculates a forward price-to-earnings ratio of approximately 15. Proponents view this as a relatively attractive valuation for a company delivering double-digit revenue growth.

The core argument is that the market may be over-discounting the risks posed by AI competition beyond what the current financials justify. This, from the analysts' perspective, creates a gap between market perception and operational reality—representing potential upside if Adobe continues to execute on its growth narrative.

The 2026 Outlook: Monetizing AI is Key

Looking ahead to 2026, execution on corporate objectives takes center stage. Management aims to grow annual recurring revenue (ARR) by more than 10% in the new fiscal year. The success of this forecast is inextricably linked to the effective monetization of AI features, including those powered by Firefly and other tools integrated across the product suite.

The strategic imperative is to leverage generative AI as a growth catalyst rather than a threat. By embedding AI capabilities directly into its subscription models and generating additional revenue from these value-added features, Adobe intends to fortify and expand its market position.

The tension for the initial trading days of 2026 thus stems from the interplay between valuation and expectation: a share price significantly below its yearly peak meets double-digit growth targets and high hopes for AI-driven revenue. Whether the optimistic analyst view prevails or the caution exhibited by some institutional investors sets the tone will likely become clearer with subsequent updates on ARR progress and the adoption rates of AI products in the coming quarters.

name: Capgemini
title: Included Health Launches AI-Enhanced, Clinician-in-the-Loop Platform
description:
Included Health has expanded its all-in-one healthcare platform with the launch of Dot, an intelligent AI assistant designed to provide continuous, personalized support with clinicians remaining closely involved.
Over the past year, the company refined and deployed Dot with large U.S. employers, processing more than 10 billion AI tokens.
Angle Health Raises $134M to Expand AI-Based Benefits Platform Angle Health, an AI-enabled healthcare benefits provider, has raised $134 million in an oversubscribed Series B round as employers face increasing pressure to control healthcare costs.
The initiative begins with upgrading the National Health Information Line (1566), which serves as the first contact for people seeking guidance on care.
By integrating AI into triage and coordination, the Ministry of Health aims to increase capacity, shorten response times, and offer more consistent support during periods of fluctuating demand...
text:
Included Health has expanded its all-in-one healthcare platform with the launch of Dot, an intelligent AI assistant designed to provide continuous, personalized support with clinicians remaining closely involved. Over the past year, the company refined and deployed Dot with large U.S. employers, processing more than 10 billion AI tokens. Dot integrates with member-specific data, including medical records, claims, benefits details, utilization trends, and social factors, enabling tailored guidance across clinical, financial, and administrative needs.

The assistant functions as a single entry point for navigating care, coverage, and costs, spanning physical, behavioral, acute, and chronic health services, while maintaining structured escalation to human clinicians when required. Nupur Srivastava, Chief Operating Officer at Included Health, noted, “Unlike mass-market chatbots that offer generic advice, Dot operates on a deep understanding of each member — drawing on medical data, claims, and benefits information to deliver truly personalized guidance.”

Chief Health Officer Ami Parekh, MD, described Dot as integral to the company’s care model, stating, “Dot is part of a team that’s building a new era of trust and opportunities for better healthcare.” Looking ahead, Included Health plans to use Dot to prompt preventive screenings, improve benefits use, support care-plan adherence, deliver its Healthy Days program, and manage tasks such as appointment scheduling, improving outcomes while reducing costs for employers and health plans.

Read more

Capgemini, UNICEF Launch AI Tool to Connect Youth with Green Careers

Capgemini has developed an agentic artificial intelligence–based career assistant to help young people identify green learning opportunities and connect with sustainable careers, building on its partnership with UNICEF. The tool, first deployed in Brazil, delivers personalized career guidance through a multi-agent AI system that operates around the clock, including in vulnerable and climate-affected regions...

Angle Health Raises $134M to Expand AI-Based Benefits Platform

Angle Health, an AI-enabled healthcare benefits provider, has raised $134 million in an oversubscribed Series B round as employers face increasing pressure to control healthcare costs. The financing was led by Portage and included Blumberg Capital, Mighty Capital, PruVen Capital, SixThirty Ventures, TSVC, Wing VC, and Y Combinator, combining both debt and equity. Total funding now stands at nearly $200 million...

Greek Government Partners with Sword Health to Build AI-Enabled National Healthcare Access System

The Greek Government has entered a national partnership with Sword Health to introduce one of Europe’s first AI-driven entry points to healthcare, intended to support more than 10 million citizens. The initiative begins with upgrading the National Health Information Line (1566), which serves as the first contact for people seeking guidance on care. By integrating AI into triage and coordination, the Ministry of Health aims to increase capacity, shorten response times, and offer more consistent support during periods of fluctuating demand...

name: Barclays
title: Santander hands customers £200 to ditch NatWest, Nationwide, Lloyds, HSBC or Barclays
description:
Customers switching to high street bank Santander are being offered as much as £200 to ditch and switch their current account.
Right now, there are three major banks offering cash incentives to lure customers to chop and change their bank.
Bank customers are notoriously stubborn, with many sticking with their bank for decades out of pure inertia despite not necessarily having access to the best rates or bonuses.
The only catch is, you can't have held a Santander current account on January 1 2025, and you can't have previously received a Santander switch payment.
Alternatively, both First Direct and Nationwide are also offering £175 to lure Santander customers, or those with other banks, into switching to them.
text:
Customers switching to high street bank Santander are being offered as much as £200 to ditch and switch their current account. Right now, there are three major banks offering cash incentives to lure customers to chop and change their bank.

Bank customers are notoriously stubborn, with many sticking with their bank for decades out of pure inertia despite not necessarily having access to the best rates or bonuses. But right now, First Direct, Nationwide and Santander are offering hard cash to get customers to switch their current bank, with many also offering high-interest linked savings accounts and cashback on top too.

Article continues below ADVERTISEMENT

Santander is offering £200 cash up front to switch, the best offer on the market right now. It also pays 1% cashback on household bills, up to a maximum of £10 a month, and access to a linked 6% interest rate savings account. Its Santander Edge account charges a £3 per month fee, but is more than made up for by the cashback.

Santander is also open to anyone to switch from any other big-name bank. Whether you're a customer of NatWest, Nationwide, Lloyds, Halifax, HSBC, Barclays or any other big name, you will be eligible to switch. The only catch is, you can't have held a Santander current account on January 1 2025, and you can't have previously received a Santander switch payment.

There’s a £500 per month minimum pay-in and you must have two active direct debits on your account. You also need to be a UK resident and be over 18.

Article continues below ADVERTISEMENT

Santander will then pay the money within 60 to 90 days of the switch being completed.

Article continues below ADVERTISEMENT

It says: "Open a Santander Edge current account. Request a switch before we remove our offer. Make sure the details you give us are correct and match those at your old bank. Complete the switch within 60 days of your request, have at least 2 active selected household Direct Debits and pay in £1,500."

There’s no set date for the offer to expire, but money expert Martin Lewis says that bank switch deals could be withdrawn at any time, so it’s best to get a move on and lock down a switch deal now.

Alternatively, both First Direct and Nationwide are also offering £175 to lure Santander customers, or those with other banks, into switching to them.

name: BNY Mellon
title: Tikehau Investment Management Decreases Position in IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. $IDXX
description:
IDEXX Laboratories comprises about 2.6% of Tikehau Investment Management's portfolio, making the stock its 12th biggest position.
Tikehau Investment Management's holdings in IDEXX Laboratories were worth $1,791,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.
Generation Investment Management LLP purchased a new position in shares of IDEXX Laboratories in the 2nd quarter valued at approximately $304,277,000.
On average, equities analysts forecast that IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. will post 11.93 earnings per share for the current year.
IDEXX Laboratories Profile (Free Report) IDEXX Laboratories, Inc NASDAQ: IDXX is a global developer, manufacturer and provider of diagnostic products and services primarily for the animal health, water testing and food safety markets.
text:
Tikehau Investment Management decreased its holdings in IDEXX Laboratories, Inc. (NASDAQ:IDXX - Free Report) by 52.5% in the third quarter, according to its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor owned 2,804 shares of the company's stock after selling 3,096 shares during the quarter. IDEXX Laboratories comprises about 2.6% of Tikehau Investment Management's portfolio, making the stock its 12th biggest position. Tikehau Investment Management's holdings in IDEXX Laboratories were worth $1,791,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.

Bullish or Bearish? Vetting Animal Health Care Stocks

Several other institutional investors and hedge funds have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in IDXX. Bank of New York Mellon Corp boosted its holdings in IDEXX Laboratories by 156.2% in the second quarter. Bank of New York Mellon Corp now owns 1,451,390 shares of the company's stock worth $778,439,000 after acquiring an additional 884,808 shares in the last quarter. Generation Investment Management LLP purchased a new position in shares of IDEXX Laboratories in the 2nd quarter valued at approximately $304,277,000. Select Equity Group L.P. acquired a new stake in IDEXX Laboratories in the 1st quarter worth approximately $194,834,000. Norges Bank purchased a new stake in IDEXX Laboratories during the 2nd quarter worth approximately $221,955,000. Finally, UBS AM A Distinct Business Unit of UBS Asset Management Americas LLC increased its stake in IDEXX Laboratories by 37.0% during the 1st quarter. UBS AM A Distinct Business Unit of UBS Asset Management Americas LLC now owns 1,076,429 shares of the company's stock valued at $452,046,000 after purchasing an additional 290,551 shares in the last quarter. 87.84% of the stock is currently owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.

Wall Street Analyst Weigh In

IDXX has been the subject of several research reports. Weiss Ratings reiterated a "hold (c+)" rating on shares of IDEXX Laboratories in a research note on Monday. Morgan Stanley raised their target price on IDEXX Laboratories from $765.00 to $805.00 and gave the stock an "overweight" rating in a research note on Tuesday, November 4th. name: Kraft Heinz
title: SoftBank closes $41 billion investment in OpenAI, earning an 11% stake. - FIRSTonline
authors: Redazione FIRSTonline, FIRSTonline editorial team, Valentina Nubola, Giuliano DeRisi, Rita Cavalli, Marika Lion, Matthew Lirosi, Federico Rendina, Tiziana Masucci, www.facebook.com
description:
Softbank ha completato integralmente il maxi investimento in OpenAI, portando a termine un impegno complessivo da 41 billion dollars e salendo così a circa l’11% del capitale della società che ha creato ChatGPT.
Circa 30 miliardi arrivano direttamente dal Vision Fund di SoftBank, mentre altri 11 miliardi sono stati raccolti presso co-investitori terzi.
Valutazione record e visione di lungo periodo Il round valorizza OpenAI su una base pre-money di 260 miliardi di dollari, confermando l’accelerazione senza precedenti degli investimenti legati all’AI.
Happy too Sam altman, CEO OpenAI, che ha sottolineato il ruolo di SoftBank, “capace di riconoscere precocemente il potenziale dell’intelligenza artificiale”, e la cui scala globale consentirà di accelerare la diffusione dell’intelligenza avanzata.
OpenAI ha già annunciato impegni infrastrutturali per oltre 1.400 miliardi di dollari nei prossimi anni, con accordi che coinvolgono produttori di chip come Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices e Broadcom.
text:
Softbank ha completato integralmente il maxi investimento in OpenAI, portando a termine un impegno complessivo da 41 billion dollars e salendo così a circa l’11% del capitale della società che ha creato ChatGPT. Secondo quanto ricostruito dalle fonti, l’ultima tranche – compresa tra 22 e 22,5 miliardi – è stata versata a fine dicembre, chiudendo un’operazione annunciata in primavera e destinata a segnare un punto fermo nella strategia del gruppo giapponese sull’intelligenza artificiale.

L’ammontare finale è superiore a quanto stabilito negli accordi. Circa 30 miliardi arrivano direttamente dal Vision Fund di SoftBank, mentre altri 11 miliardi sono stati raccolti presso co-investitori terzi. Si tratta della più grande operazione mai realizzata dal conglomerato in un’unica società.

Valutazione record e visione di lungo periodo

Il round valorizza OpenAI su una base pre-money di 260 miliardi di dollari, confermando l’accelerazione senza precedenti degli investimenti legati all’AI. Alla guida di questa scommessa c’è il fondatore e presidente di SoftBank, Masayoshi Son, che ha ribadito l’allineamento strategico con la società americana, “siamo profondamente allineati con la visione di OpenAI per garantire che lo sviluppo dell’intelligenza artificiale generale apporti benefici a tutta l’umanità”.

Happy too Sam altman, CEO OpenAI, che ha sottolineato il ruolo di SoftBank, “capace di riconoscere precocemente il potenziale dell’intelligenza artificiale”, e la cui scala globale consentirà di accelerare la diffusione dell’intelligenza avanzata.

L’infrastruttura al centro della corsa all’IA

Il rafforzamento della partecipazione in OpenAI si inserisce in una corsa globale alle infrastrutture necessarie a sostenere la nuova ondata di applicazioni basate sull’AI. OpenAI ha già annunciato impegni infrastrutturali per oltre 1.400 miliardi di dollari nei prossimi anni, con accordi che coinvolgono produttori di chip come Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices e Broadcom.

name: OpenAI
title: SoftBank Sealed Its OpenAI Bet As Chips And Tech Slipped - Finimize
description:
stock fell.
Elsewhere, TransDigm agreed to buy aerospace and defense electronics supplier Stellant Systems for about $960 million in cash.
For markets: AI is still funded but semis are the scoreboard.
The split between AI-linked manufacturers like TSMC and more cycle-sensitive names like GlobalFoundries suggests investors may keep rewarding leading-edge AI supply chains while treating the rest of the sector more cautiously.
Meanwhile, deals like TransDigm’s Stellant purchase show steadier end markets can keep consolidation going even when tech sentiment cools.
text:
stock fell. Elsewhere, TransDigm agreed to buy aerospace and defense electronics supplier Stellant Systems for about $960 million in cash.

Why should I care?

For markets: AI is still funded but semis are the scoreboard.

SoftBank’s move says capital is still flowing to AI models and software, even when megacap tech has a weak day. But semiconductors often set the tone because supply constraints and orders show up there first. The split between AI-linked manufacturers like TSMC and more cycle-sensitive names like GlobalFoundries suggests investors may keep rewarding leading-edge AI supply chains while treating the rest of the sector more cautiously.

The bigger picture: Tech is running two cycles at once.

AI compute demand is accelerating, yet parts of the chip industry are still in a slowdown – and that mismatch can redirect spending toward advanced manufacturing and data-center infrastructure. It can also widen the gap between companies exposed to AI capex and those tied to PCs, phones, or older-node production. Meanwhile, deals like TransDigm’s Stellant purchase show steadier end markets can keep consolidation going even when tech sentiment cools.

description:

Born on March 31, 1948, in Gouverneur, NY, the daughter of the late Dallas and Beulah (Martin) Luther.
She is survived by her daughters; Rhonda (Richard) Synesael and Renee Luther (Shawn Horton), her son; Randy (Sara) Luther, twenty grandchildren, 21 great-grandchildren; several nieces, nephews and cousins.
Mildred was predeceased by her beloved husband, Carl H. Turner, Sr. in 2000 and an infant son, Russell S. Luther.
Please consider donations to; The American Cancer Society, Golisano Hope Lodge, 1120 S. Goodman St. Rochester, NY, 14620.
text:
NORTH ROSE: Mildred Turner, 77, passed away peacefully on Friday, December 26, 2025 at the Hildebrant Hospice Center, with her family by her side.

Friends and family are invited to attend calling hours Sunday, January 4, 2026 from11:00 am to 3:00 pm at the Norton Funeral Home, 45 W. Main Street, Sodus, NY. A service will immediately follow at 3:00 pm. A private family burial will take place the Lakeview/ Pultneyville Cemetery at the convenience of the family.

Born on March 31, 1948, in Gouverneur, NY, the daughter of the late Dallas and Beulah (Martin) Luther. Mildred retired from Parker Hannifin in Clyde, NY. She loved gardening, fishing, camping and especially time spent with her family.

She is survived by her daughters; Rhonda (Richard) Synesael and Renee Luther (Shawn Horton), her son; Randy (Sara) Luther, twenty grandchildren, 21 great-grandchildren; several nieces, nephews and cousins. Mildred was one of 5 sisters and 5 brothers.

Mildred was predeceased by her beloved husband, Carl H. Turner, Sr. in 2000 and an infant son, Russell S. Luther.

Please consider donations to; The American Cancer Society, Golisano Hope Lodge, 1120 S. Goodman St. Rochester, NY, 14620.

name: Adobe
title: After Effects News December 2025 by Rich Young - ProVideo Coalition
description:
The current release of Adobe After Effects remains November 2025 (25.6), which includes new features and workflow improvements.
Meanwhile, School of Motion posted an 11-hour “Year in Review” roundup, The MEGA 2025 Motion Design Roundup Episode.
See How to Match Colours Across Photoshop, Illustrator and After Effects and A Surprising Free Alternative for Surface Tracking.
Adobe Video a simple but effective way to make snow in ‘Tis the Season for an After Effects Snow Tutorial | @filmriot x.
If you ever wondered what a cinematic gradient was, grok this by SonduckFilm: Create Cinematic Motion Graphics with Gradients After Effects.
text:
The current release of Adobe After Effects remains November 2025 (25.6), which includes new features and workflow improvements.

Previous release details can be found in recent roundups. The November 2025 (25.6) release includes important fixes, known issues, and some added features like:

Modify Default Camera Settings

Extensive fixes and improvements

Single 3D Gizmo for multiple 3D layers

Tip of the Day

…and the rest from the previous release…

Quickly offset your layers and keyframes

Copy and paste only the text formatting

Support for CICP metadata

Learn about Effects before applying them (info icon)

Automatically relaunch when required by preferences or features

New Product Community and Creator resources with feedback, stock items, and tutorials.

Adobe video and audio products no longer support Rosetta

The top features in beta, (version 26.1.1) was last updated on December 17 2025, includes:

Support for Variable Font Axes (more from Sean Jenkins)

Create parametric meshes

Substance 3D Materials (SBSAR)

Lossless Compressed Playback

Unmult effect for Keying transparency

New built-in audio effects

Crop Composition to Selected Layer(s) Bounds

Import SVG files as vectors

Improved Illustrator layer conversion

Improved UI language support

Change anchor point in a more efficient way

Duplicate layers using Alt/Option-drag

Enable lights to cast shadows

After Effects Preferences Refresh

A recent beta version snapshot was dubbed the BIGGEST After Effects Update EVER! by Jake In Motion and other leading commentators.

PVC staff posted a nice digestable discussion of industry trends with The next level of AI, cameras, remote workflows and more for 2026 – A PVC Roundtable Discussion.

Meanwhile, School of Motion posted an 11-hour “Year in Review” roundup, The MEGA 2025 Motion Design Roundup Episode. It may take a few days to get through it all. You can find documentation in the show notes.

It’s been almost a year: Artlist discontinued the FXhome apps: HitFilm and Imerge dead.

Jake In Motion posted a short video every day for 12 days of Christmas or another holiday. It seems you get a free script with each. Here’s an example: INSTANT Wiggle Rig | Free After Effects Script.

As usual, SternFX has some useful tutorials. See How to Match Colours Across Photoshop, Illustrator and After Effects and A Surprising Free Alternative for Surface Tracking.

Looks fun… ProductionCrate Black Hole, a free After Effects plug-in.

Eric Demeusy animated the original Stranger Things title sequence back in 2015, and now is showing us his flow in How I Animated the Original Stranger Things Title Sequence – Full After Effects Tutorial. You’ll have to substitute some effects but that fine.

Adobe Video a simple but effective way to make snow in ‘Tis the Season for an After Effects Snow Tutorial | @filmriot x. There are many other ways to create snow particles, and many were referenced in Snow in After Effects: an updated roundup here on AEP.

After Effects Tricks! shows the Sunburst preset in AE. If you want to find out how to make them yourself, check out Sunbursts or radial rays in After Effects here on AEP. It seemed more interesting 15 years ago!

If you ever wondered what a cinematic gradient was, grok this by SonduckFilm: Create Cinematic Motion Graphics with Gradients After Effects.

At VideoRevealed, Colin shows off object masking in Unlock the Future of Masking in Premiere Beta. Look ma, no Rotobrush.

Using just Photoshop and After Effects, Justin Serran turns static AI images into “;cinematic” 3D animations without using complex (or faux) 3D in My Full AI-to-Animation Workflow (Free Project Files).

Here on PVC, Jeff Foster considers AI Tools: 2025 A Year in Review. Jeff ads this to his hand basket:

~

name: Ralph Lauren
title: USPS to open entry to its last-mile delivery network - Linns Stamp News
description:
By Linn’s Staff The United States Postal Service has announced that it will provide entry to its last-mile delivery network.
More details will be provided in the months ahead, the Postal Service said.
“We want to make the service as convenient, cost-effective and efficient as possible.” “The Postal Service’s valuable last-mile network can now be our customer’s advantage,” Steiner said.
“The [Postal Service] expects to notify winning bidders in the second calendar quarter [of 2026], and service under those NSAs would begin in the third calendar quarter of 2026,” the Postal Service said.
“By changing the way last-mile service is offered, the Postal Service is expanding the reach of retailers and others who value same-day or next-day delivery,” the Postal Service said.
text:
By Linn’s Staff

The United States Postal Service has announced that it will provide entry to its last-mile delivery network.

“Shippers large and small will be able to access the more than 18,000 USPS delivery destination units (DDUs) nationwide via a solicitation process that will begin accepting bids in late January or early February 2026,” the Postal Service said in a Dec. 17 press release.

Prior to launching a dedicated bid solicitation platform, the USPS will meet with shippers to determine their level of interest and hone the bidding process based on shippers’ feedback. More details will be provided in the months ahead, the Postal Service said.

“We want to allow customers to custom-build their last mile solution,” Postmaster General David Steiner said. “We want to make the service as convenient, cost-effective and efficient as possible.”

“The Postal Service’s valuable last-mile network can now be our customer’s advantage,” Steiner said. “Our last mile can become our customer’s last mile.”

Recent substantial investments in modernization have significantly boosted the Postal Service’s package processing and delivery capacity. This will allow the USPS to satisfy a much bigger percentage of the country’s shipping needs than it provides now.

The USPS plans to formalize accepted bids using a negotiated service agreement (NSA).

“The [Postal Service] expects to notify winning bidders in the second calendar quarter [of 2026], and service under those NSAs would begin in the third calendar quarter of 2026,” the Postal Service said.

“By changing the way last-mile service is offered, the Postal Service is expanding the reach of retailers and others who value same-day or next-day delivery,” the Postal Service said. “USPS wants to provide a reach that is unparalleled in the history of the United States.”

description:

Hong Kong to launch digital cargo tracking, data exchange network The use of real-time cargo status data is expected to make trade finance more efficient, reducing credit costs and processing and payment times, the Hong Kong government said.

name: Eli Lilly
title: Eli Lilly Plans to Acquire Abivix, Could This Deal Become a New Growth Engine? | NAI 500
description:
Recent market rumors suggest that Eli Lilly may be undertaking a significant strategic move—acquiring the French biotechnology company Abivax.
Over the past two years, Eli Lilly has expanded its pipeline through acquisitions in various fields, including oncology.
Therefore, this acquisition holds strong strategic appeal for Eli Lilly, though the cost may also be substantial—market rumors have already driven Abivax’s market value significantly higher.
Strategic Considerations for Diversified Expansion This potential deal highlights Eli Lilly’s strategic mindset of not relying solely on a single growth engine.
These risks include intensified future market competition, challenges after patent expirations, and potential setbacks in the R&D pipeline.
text:
Eli Lilly (LLY) has significantly enhanced its market position and stock price in recent years, driven by its strong performance in the GLP-1 drug sector, making its future prospects highly anticipated. However, outstanding companies never settle for a single track; they consistently strive to seek diversified growth pathways. Recent market rumors suggest that Eli Lilly may be undertaking a significant strategic move—acquiring the French biotechnology company Abivax. This move could inject new momentum into its future outlook.

A Potential Major Acquisition

Large pharmaceutical companies often enrich their product pipelines through acquisitions or licensing agreements, an efficient way to supplement R&D assets. Over the past two years, Eli Lilly has expanded its pipeline through acquisitions in various fields, including oncology. According to media reports, the company is in acquisition talks with Abivax. Abivax’s core asset is the Phase III clinical-stage drug obefazimod, which is intended for treating ulcerative colitis (UC) and has the potential to expand into other immune-related diseases.

Although the UC market already has various therapies, including Eli Lilly’s own product Omvoh, obefazimod has demonstrated significant efficacy in clinical trials for moderate-to-severe patients, particularly those who have not responded well to previous treatments, thanks to its unique mechanism of action. If approved, it could become a “blockbuster” drug. Therefore, this acquisition holds strong strategic appeal for Eli Lilly, though the cost may also be substantial—market rumors have already driven Abivax’s market value significantly higher.

Strategic Considerations for Diversified Expansion

This potential deal highlights Eli Lilly’s strategic mindset of not relying solely on a single growth engine. While its GLP-1 product line remains the core growth driver for the foreseeable future, the company’s management is clearly planning ahead to mitigate potential risks. These risks include intensified future market competition, challenges after patent expirations, and potential setbacks in the R&D pipeline.

Eli Lilly is building long-term competitiveness through a multi-pronged approach: in addition to exploring acquisitions like Abivax to strengthen its immunology portfolio, the company is actively expanding into new therapeutic areas such as oncology and investing in AI supercomputers to enhance the efficiency and success rate of drug development. This forward-looking strategy aims to create a sustainable growth foundation for the company.

Evaluation from an Investor’s Perspective

Eli Lilly’s current financial performance is robust, and its growth momentum is expected to continue. Whether the acquisition of Abivax ultimately materializes, the company’s solid foundation based on its existing core business, combined with its diversified strategic layout for long-term development, makes its stock persistently attractive. For investors, Eli Lilly demonstrates not only the ability to deliver short-term performance but also a clear blueprint for navigating future uncertainties and consolidating its industry leadership through continuous strategic investments.

name: J&J
title: In a rare formal complaint, a federal judge is accused of bullying law clerks | KUNC
authors: Carrie Johnson, Mary Louise Kelly, www.kunc.org, carrie-johnson, mary-louise-kelly
description:
Now, this is a rare step to file a misconduct complaint against a federal appeals court judge.
It is also the latest flashpoint in a debate about whether the federal courts can police themselves.
JOHNSON: Judge Sarah Merriam's an appeals court judge on the 2nd Circuit.
She was actually nominated by President Joe Biden and previously served as a district court judge and a magistrate in Connecticut.
That's what happened with a federal judge in Alaska who allegedly created a sexualized environment with his clerks.
text:
MARY LOUISE KELLY, HOST:

A nonprofit group that advocates for law clerks is alleging a judge, Sarah Merriam, bullies and mistreats clerks. Now, this is a rare step to file a misconduct complaint against a federal appeals court judge. It is also the latest flashpoint in a debate about whether the federal courts can police themselves. NPR's Carrie Johnson has been reporting on that issue, so we've asked her to come tell us more. Hi, Carrie.

CARRIE JOHNSON, BYLINE: Hi there.

KELLY: OK. Tell us more. What do we know about this judge?

JOHNSON: Judge Sarah Merriam's an appeals court judge on the 2nd Circuit. That's a very prestigious job with life tenure. She was actually nominated by President Joe Biden and previously served as a district court judge and a magistrate in Connecticut. Earlier in her career, she worked as a federal public defender. But I've also learned about some concerns about her behavior in chambers toward her law clerks. A group called The Legal Accountability Project filed a formal complaint based on conversations with her former clerks. Aliza Shatzman is founder of that project.

ALIZA SHATZMAN: We are filing this complaint because we can shoulder risks that, frankly, many law clerks perceive they cannot. But I hope that clerks will learn about this complaint and feel empowered to come forward to file complaints themselves.

JOHNSON: Shatzman says she's heard of the judge yelling, issuing all-caps emails. She says one clerk quit after only one month on the job. And at least four others got offered jobs there as clerks but then withdrew, apparently because they heard problems about the workplace through the whisper network.

KELLY: The response from the court to this complaint is what, Carrie?

JOHNSON: There is no response from the judge herself or from officials in the 2nd Circuit Appeals Court. And a judiciary spokesman here in D.C. has declined comment. The courts actually manage themselves. It's part of their tradition of independence and the separation of powers. But this case is interesting, in part because this project says Judge Merriam is the subject of a previous complaint. There's a public order from 2023 that does not name this judge but seems to match details in the new filing from The Legal Accountability Project. That investigation found the judge had an overly harsh management style. Officials closed the investigation after the judge agreed to watch workplace videos and receive some counseling.

KELLY: Just fill in a little bit of the context here for us. The misconduct process in the federal courts, how is it supposed to work?

JOHNSON: Filing a formal complaint is very rare. Only a few of them are filed every year even though there are hundreds of federal judges. Law clerks are wary because they fear retaliation. They really can't report bullying or abusive conduct without that getting back to the judge, and that could destroy their legal careers. Federal judges have so much power, especially over clerks. And people who work in the federal courts don't have the same employment protections other Americans do. Again, Aliza Shatzman.

SHATZMAN: Federal judges are exempt from antidiscrimination laws. So in most other workplaces, if you are mistreated in this way, you can sue your harasser.

JOHNSON: And that's worth emphasizing. The federal courts are exempt from Title VII antidiscrimination laws. So people who work there generally cannot sue over mistreatment on the job. They have to use the court's internal process to complain and try to seek justice. And our NPR investigation this year found problems with that process.

KELLY: So, Carrie, where does this situation go from here?

JOHNSON: If the 2nd Circuit Court decides to proceed with an investigation, it might interview current and former law clerks and maybe other people in the courthouse or chambers. Shatzman and other advocates for clerks have been trying for years to get Congress to expand workplace protections for people who work for the courts. So far, that's gone nowhere in Congress. And judges can only be removed from office if they're impeached. That hardly ever happens. But in a few recent cases, judges have been pressured to resign or retire. That's what happened with a federal judge in Alaska who allegedly created a sexualized environment with his clerks. He resigned and has since been disbarred.

KELLY: NPR's Carrie Johnson. Thank you, Carrie.

JOHNSON: Thank you. Transcript provided by NPR, Copyright NPR.

name: OpenAI
title: OpenAI Explores Ads as AI Monetization Struggle Intensifies - Tech Labari
description:
Despite billions in investment from tech giants like Google, Meta, and OpenAI, AI chatbots have yet to become profit engines.
By entering the advertising fray, the Sam Altman-led company would directly challenge the “Big Three” of digital ads—Google, Meta, and Amazon—who currently control 60% of the global market (excluding China).
The Strategy According to a report citing internal sources, OpenAI is “tweaking” its AI models to prioritize sponsored information in specific contexts.
The Balance: A key internal focus is “not turning off users.” OpenAI is treading carefully to ensure ads don’t feel intrusive or compromise the personal nature of the chat experience.
60%: Combined market share of Google, Meta, and Amazon in digital ads.
text:
Despite billions in investment from tech giants like Google, Meta, and OpenAI, AI chatbots have yet to become profit engines.

To bridge the gap, OpenAI is reportedly developing plans to integrate advertising directly into ChatGPT conversations.

Why it matters

OpenAI sits on a “goldmine” of user intent data. By entering the advertising fray, the Sam Altman-led company would directly challenge the “Big Three” of digital ads—Google, Meta, and Amazon—who currently control 60% of the global market (excluding China).

The Strategy

According to a report citing internal sources, OpenAI is “tweaking” its AI models to prioritize sponsored information in specific contexts.

The UX: Users may see sponsored results for products (like mascara) when asking for recommendations.

The Format: Employees have reportedly mocked up sidebars for sponsored content and clear disclosure labels to indicate paid results.

The Balance: A key internal focus is “not turning off users.” OpenAI is treading carefully to ensure ads don’t feel intrusive or compromise the personal nature of the chat experience.

By the Numbers

OpenAI’s scale makes it a formidable advertising platform:

900 million: Current weekly active users.

2.6 billion: Target active user base by 2030.

60%: Combined market share of Google, Meta, and Amazon in digital ads.

The Pivot

While CEO Sam Altman has publicly downplayed ad ambitions in the past, the company’s recent actions suggest a shift in priority:

Hiring: OpenAI has been recruiting digital advertising veterans over the past year.

Features: Development is underway for shopping features specifically designed to host retail ads.

The bottom line

AI is expensive to run. While OpenAI has relied on subscriptions and enterprise deals so far, the massive compute costs required to reach billions of users are making a high-margin ad model almost inevitable.

What’s next

There is no confirmed timeline for when ads will go live. OpenAI remains in the testing and “mockup” phase as it weighs user sentiment against the need for revenue.

Medtronic Company Profile

(Get Free Report)

Medtronic plc is a global medical technology company that develops and manufactures a broad range of therapeutic devices and health care solutions. Headquartered legally in Ireland with principal operational offices in the United States, the company markets products to hospitals, physicians and health systems worldwide and has grown from its founding in 1949 into one of the largest medical-device manufacturers serving global health-care markets.

Medtronic's offerings span several clinical areas, including cardiac rhythm and heart failure (pacemakers, implantable cardioverter‑defibrillators and related cardiac therapies), minimally invasive and surgical technologies (laparoscopic and advanced energy devices, visualization systems and surgical innovations), restorative therapies (spine and orthopedics, neuromodulation and neurovascular treatments) and diabetes management (insulin-delivery systems and glucose monitoring solutions).

name: J&J
title: Hawks 126-102 Timberwolves (Dec 31, 2025) Game Recap - ESPN
description:
ATLANTA -- — Jalen Johnson scored 34 points and the Atlanta Hawks overcame Anthony Edwards' 30 points for Minnesota to beat the Timberwolves 126-102 on Wednesday and end a seven-game losing streak.
Johnson added 10 rebounds and six assists.
Onyeka Okongwu had 17 points and Dyson Daniels added 11 points, eight rebounds and nine assists.
Gobert had 11 rebounds.
Nickeil Alexander-Walker, who played the last three seasons for Minnesota, scored 11 points as the fill-in starting point guard.
text:
ATLANTA -- — Jalen Johnson scored 34 points and the Atlanta Hawks overcame Anthony Edwards' 30 points for Minnesota to beat the Timberwolves 126-102 on Wednesday and end a seven-game losing streak.

Atlanta took control by outscoring Minnesota 37-23 in the second quarter to lead 70-49 at halftime.

Johnson added 10 rebounds and six assists. Onyeka Okongwu had 17 points and Dyson Daniels added 11 points, eight rebounds and nine assists. Daniels also had two steals and two blocks.

The Hawks claimed their first win since beating Philadelphia 120-117 on Dec. 14 and improved to 6-11 at home.

The Hawks were bolstered by the return of Kristaps Porzingis, who scored 16 points in 17 minutes off the bench after missing 10 games with an illness.

“It's really good to have him back because he's a really good player,” Hawks coach Quin Snyder said of Porzingis before the game.

Luke Kennard added 15 points off Atlanta's bench.

Edwards, the Atlanta native, had 24 first-half points. The Timberwolves had too little scoring depth to keep pace with the Hawks.

Julius Randle scored 19 points and Johnny Juzang had 10. Minnesota had no other player score in double figures. Jaden McDaniels had eight points while Rudy Gobert and Donte DiVincenzo each had six. Gobert had 11 rebounds.

Minnesota coach Chris Finch pulled all his starters for the final several minutes.

Trae Young missed his second consecutive game for Atlanta with a right quad contusion and was in street clothes on the bench for the second half. Nickeil Alexander-Walker, who played the last three seasons for Minnesota, scored 11 points as the fill-in starting point guard.

Johnson (illness) started after missing one game.

Up next

Timberwolves: Visit Miami on Saturday.

Hawks: Visit New York Knicks on Friday night.

------

text:
by Fern Siegel , 11 hours ago

Creative agency Starfish is launching a brand platform for Crisil, an S&P Global company.

Crisil specializes in credit ratings, data and analytics. The new platform, “Crisil. The Coefficient of Confidence,” unifies the company’s global positioning with new visual assets and activations, while refining its message.

“At the heart of Crisil's reputation is one defining strength; confidence anchored in precision,” said David Kessler, Starfish CEO. “Our work distilled this essence into a compelling platform that aligns strategy with experience, and helps the brand show up with clarity in every market and touchpoint.”

Starfish's branding work includes Avis, Dunkin', Samsung and PwC.
